headline.main: DALADIER CHARGES TREASON AIDED FOE; Says at Riom People's Instinct Told of Treachery and That Trial Data Support View SUPPLY FAILURES CITED Quartermaster Reveals Shoes and Uniforms Were Available While Army Suffered

lead_paragraph: RIOM, France, April 2 -- Treason charges were injected into the French unpreparedness trial here today as the Supreme Court recessed over the Easter holidays. There was not the slightest intimation of any intention of discontinuance or prolonged interruptions of proceedings and Presiding Magistrate Pierre Caous announced that the trial would be resumed April 14 at 1 P.M.
abstract: Daladier charges treason as QM Gen Bernard reveals army supplies lack due to distribution neglect instead of alleged shortages; Gen Marescaux testifies; Gen Hurealt accuses Blum Govt of cutting 1936 supplies credits; Gamelin testifies
